subject: Cybersecurity
title: Double Extortion: Pay Twice or Else
description: One-minute skill: Double Extortion: Pay Twice or Else.

hook.text: First they encrypt your files. Then they threaten to publish them. You pay to decrypt AND to keep them secret.

buildup.text: Double extortion adds data theft to ransomware. Even if you have backups, they'll leak your sensitive data publicly.

discovery.text: Maze ransomware pioneered this in 2019, creating a 'shame site' where stolen data was published if victims didn't pay.

twist.text: Some groups now do triple extortion: encrypt, threaten to leak, AND DDoS your website until you pay.

climax.text: Backups no longer defeat ransomware. When data theft is the real threat, the only defense is preventing the initial breach.

punchline.text: Backups used to save you. Now they just lower one of two ransoms.

quiz.question: What is 'double extortion' in ransomware attacks?
options: Encrypting files AND threatening to publish stolen data unless paid
